main event: A UFO was observed in the vicinity of Tempe, Arizona on January 6, 1957.
interesting points: The UFO was first observed at an altitude of 2000 feet and descended to an altitude of 500 feet.
The UFO appeared to be elliptical in shape, approximately 30 feet in diameter, and was observed for a period of 3 to 5 minutes.
The UFO emitted no exhaust or trail and made no sound.
The UFO was observed to accelerate rapidly and depart the area at a high rate of speed.
A separate sighting occurred in Tempe, Arizona on January 6, 1957, where a bright red luminance was observed moving back and forth from SW to NE for 10 minutes before disappearing.
sighted object: An elliptical-shaped UFO, approximately 30 feet in diameter
witnesses: A 2nd Lt. USAFR pilot, and Mr. and Mrs. Richard Schroeder
